before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"3rvs9","text":"GoTaq® Enviro Wastewater SARS-CoV-2 Systems are sensitive; take precautions to minimize contamination. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec729","text":"Store the reagents separately from RNA/TNA (total nucleic acid) samples. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3e69v","text":"Use a clean designated work area and separate pipettes for pre- and post-amplification steps to minimize the potential for cross-contamination between RNA samples and to prevent carryover of nucleic acid from one run to the next. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mrp7","text":"Wear a lab coat and protective eyewear. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hdv","text":"Wear gloves and change them often.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhtkc","text":"Prevent contamination by using aerosol-resistant pipette tips. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vs2e","text":"Always include a no-template control (NTC) reaction to detect contamination. We recommend performing NTC reactions in triplicate.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"asnva","text":"This protocol details methods for the preparation of RTqPCR for the CDC's N1 fragment of the nucleocopsid gene of SARS-CoV-2 using the Promega GoTaq® Enviro Wastewater SARS-CoV-2 System (AM2110). Total Nucleic Acid (TNA) from the Promega Maxwell® RSC Enviro TNA Kit (Cat.# AS1831) is used as input. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jtv9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6enf4","text":"This system is a one-step RT-qPCR. In addition to the N1 primer/probe, it includes an internal process control, Pepper Mild Mottle Virus (PMMoV), to allow for normalization and an internal amplification control (IAC). The GoTaq® Enviro Master Mix, provided in this kit, uses proprietary enzymes and formulations that tolerate reverse transcriptase and PCR inhibitors such as humic acids, that can be present in nucleic acid samples purified from wastewater.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqekn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"6nl4d","text":"This protocol has been tested only for RTqPCR of the N1 fragment of the SARS-CoV-2 nucleocapsid gene using an AB 7500 Fast Thermal Cycler. The GoTaq® Enviro Wastewater SARS-CoV-2 Systems are RT-qPCR kits designed for detecting SARS-CoV-2 genetic signal from wastewater samples that have been pre-processed. Pre-processing includes viral concentration and purification of nucleic acid. The purified nucleic acid is then used for RT-qPCR. Viral concentration and purification can be achieved by using one of the following kits:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9q96","text":"Wizard® Enviro TNA Kit (Cat.# A2991)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7iqrn","text":"Maxwell® RSC Enviro TNA Kit (Cat.# AS1831)\n","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2oo7","text":"Promega offers GoTaq® Enviro Wastewater SARS-CoV-2 System RTqPCR kits for N1 (AM2110), N1/N2/E (AM2100), N2 (AM2120) and E (AM2130), the protocol is the same for all kits.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3p1e9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b0b6","text":"Alternative viral concentration methods can also be used, such as PEG 8000/NaCl precipitation, membrane filtration, centrifugal ultrafiltration, skimmed milk flocculation or other methods. Nucleic acid purification can be performed on the concentrated viral material using manual or automated systems.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sv67","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6igms","text":"Do not unseal reaction plates after amplification is complete. Unsealing the plates increases the risk of contaminating subsequent reactions with amplified product.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfedv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4888e","text":"Full system information, including related products, is available at  https://www.promega.com/products/pcr/qpcr-and-rt-qpcr/sars-cov-2-rt-qpcr-kit-for-wastewater/?catNum=AM2100#overview","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":70,"length":115}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"ADB3B50FCB1711ECA8E90A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.promega.com/products/pcr/qpcr-and-rt-qpcr/sars-cov-2-rt-qpcr-kit-for-wastewater/?catNum=AM2100#overview"}}}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"a8tov","text":"GoTaq® Enviro Wastewater SARS-CoV-2 System, N1 200 reactions Catalog Number: AM2110","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":77,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c340l","text":"    kit includes:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1q5gp","text":"        2 × 100μl N1 \u0026 PMMoV Primer/Probe/IAC Mix, 20X","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"170av","text":"        2 × 1,000μL GoTaq® Enviro Master Mix, 2X","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3fgd","text":"           1 × 100μL GoScript™ Enzyme Mix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4g726","text":"           2 ×  1.25mL Nuclease-Free Water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fadpq","text":"           1 × 100μL SARS-CoV-2 (N+E) RNA, 4 × 106 copies/μL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":49,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agaih","text":"           1 × 100μL PMMoV RNA, 4 × 106 copies/μL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":38,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5bv6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31h3j","text":"Storage Conditions: Store all components of the GoTaq® Enviro Wastewater SARS-CoV-2 Systems at –30°C to –10°C. Limit freeze-thaws to five cycles or less. Store the 20X Primer/Probe/IPC mixes protected from light.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"an5le","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hbuh","text":"Materials to Be Supplied by User:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sl0b","text":"10% Bleach for cleaning workspaces","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28pg0","text":"RNAseAway 7000TS1 (or similar)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bn51","text":"Sterile aerosol-resistant barrier pipette tips","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1q8h9","text":"Pipettes dedicated to pre-amplification work","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"457qi","text":"1.5mL microcentrifuge tubes to prepare the reaction mixes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5goip","text":"0.5mL low-bind microcentrifuge tubes (e.g., Eppendorf Cat.# 022431005) to prepare the standard dilutions","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ogk8","text":"qPCR plates (e.g. MicroAmp™ Optical 96-Well Reaction Plate Catalog Number: N8010560 ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":74,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bfgq","text":"Adhesive covers (e.g., MicroAmp™ Optical Adhesive Film 4311971) OR optical strip caps (e.g., MicroAmp™ Optical 8-Cap Strips 4323032)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":63,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":123,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ad47","text":"ABI 7500 Fast qPCR thermal cycler (or similar)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afh7a","text":"Ice bucket \u0026 ice OR ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e390r","text":"Corning XT Ice-free Cooling Core 432014 \u0026 Corning™ CoolRack™ XT PCR Tube Module 432053 (or similar)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":80,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nv8q","text":"Centrifuge for microcentrifuge and reagent tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bku1t","text":"Centrifuge for 96-well plates","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hss3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tkbr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnkrt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8iqid","text":"Thaw the SARS-CoV-2 (N+E) RNA, 4 × 106 copies/μl, and PMMoV RNA, 4 × 106 copies/μL, on ice. Avoid long exposures to ambient temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":37,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":71,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcge1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ed2i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4huek","text":"Combine and dilute the SARS-CoV-2 (N+E) and PMMoV RNAs (4 × 106 copies/μL) 100-fold by adding 2μL of each RNA to 196μL of Nuclease-Free Water, for a final concentration of 4 × 104 copies/μL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":62,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":178,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7acak","text":"Perform subsequent serial tenfold dilutions in low-binding 0.5mL tubes. For example, combine 5μl of RNA with 45μL of Nuclease-Free Water to obtain the following standard curve dilutions (4 × 104–4 copies/μL; see Table 1 and Figure 1). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":193,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27r5r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"db658","text":"Vortex each dilution for 3–5 seconds prior to removing an aliquot for the next dilution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cjto","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gjnq","text":"Change pipette tips between dilutions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvq4q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a42va","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"92h8t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tm4d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3j8ft","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CEB81B30D51E11ECBB8BA9FBB750FE11","height":240.3709090909091,"id":242620,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6a161","text":"Figure 1. Dilution scheme for combined SARS-CoV-2 (N+E) and PMMoV RNA Standards","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-16 at 9.47.11 AM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hn78bccbx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hn76bccbx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hn77bccbx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hn75bccbx.webp","width":379.8965517241379}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"}},"colTitles":["Tube","SARS-Cov-2 (N+E) and PMMoV RNA (copies/uL)","Copies/Well (4uL sample/10uL reaction)"],"colWidths":[100,"174","169"],"data":[["A","4 x 10^4","1.6 x 10^5"],["B","4 x 10^3","1.6 x 10^4"],["C","4 x 10^2","1.6 x 10^3"],["D","40","160"],["E","4","16"]],"guid":"F19B7200CB1911EC894B39DFCEF9CE93","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b3en6","text":"Table 1. steps.section: Preparing the RT-qPCR Reaction Mix (10μl Reaction Volume)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"291id","text":"Vortex GoTaq® Enviro Master Mix (green cap) briefly before use to ensure homogeneity. Centrifuge briefly to collect contents at bottom of tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":12,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9l8ph","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vajc","text":"Pulse centrifuge GoScript™Enzyme Mix (yellow cap), Primer/Probe/IAC Mix (20X) (blue cap), and Nuclease-Free water (white cap) to collect contents at bottom of tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"88jfl","text":"Single-run aliquots (~15uL of each dilution) can be distributed in strip tubes and frozen at -20ºC. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44cd6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"431lh","text":"Keep standards separate from TNA and the RTqPCR reaction reagents. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12jqo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fjvo","text":"Following the above instructions will generate enough 15uL aliquots for 3 runs. The volumes of dilutions B-E can be increased (e.g. 10uL into 90uL H2O) to create more aliquots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":148,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing the RT-qPCR Reaction Mix (10μl Reaction Volume)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"23i42","text":"Determine the number of reactions. This includes reactions for the unknown samples, combined SARS-CoV-2 (N+E) and PMMoV RNA standards, and negative control reactions in duplicate or triplicate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mcpa","text":"If number of samples (n) including controls ≤14, then N = n + 2","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm6cl","text":"If number of samples (n) including controls is ≥ 15 or greater, then N = n + 5","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vphu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ioij","text":"While this approach consumes additional reagents, it ensures that enough RT-qPCR amplification mix will be available for all samples. It also ensures that each reaction contains the same RT-qPCR amplification mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing the RT-qPCR Reaction Mix (10μl Reaction Volume)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f5916","text":"Prepare the reaction mix for the number of reactions (N) calculated in step 5 in a 1.5mL microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lma","text":"The Master Mix and Enzyme Mix are viscous; take care to pipette slowly to ensure accurate volumes are transferred. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":56,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8k9o1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dt4hc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gcge","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"84qib","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qjhj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6q54","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_1":{"className":" "},"C_2":{"className":" "},"C_3":{"className":" "},"C_4":{"className":" "}},"colTitles":["Component","Volume (V)","Number of Reactions (N)","Final volume (V x N)"],"colWidths":["199","106","150","139"],"data":[["GoTaq® Enviro Master Mix (2X)","5µL","",""],["GoScript™Enzyme Mix","0.2µL","",""],["Primer/Probe/IAC Mix (20X)","0.5µL","",""],["Nuclease-Free Water","0.3µL","",""]],"guid":"7250CCA0CBC011ECBECCBD70339C4CC1","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eaikr","text":"Table 4. Reaction Mix Worksheet for 10μl Reaction Volume.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["GoTaq® Enviro Master Mix (2X)","5µL","",""],["GoScript™Enzyme Mix","0.2µL","",""],["Primer/Probe/IAC Mix (20X)","0.5µL","",""],["Nuclease-Free Water","0.3µL","",""]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ov32","text":"Keep reaction mix in a cold block or on ice, protected from light.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Preparing the RT-qPCR Reaction Mix (10μl Reaction Volume)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7tieu","text":"Place a 96-well qPCR plate on a cold block or ice and carefully pipette 6μl of RT-qPCR reaction mix into the appropriate wells according to the plate map","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing the RT-qPCR Reaction Mix (10μl Reaction Volume)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4pebq","text":"Add 4μl of TNA (or RNA), combined SARS-CoV-2 (N+E) and PMMoV RNA standards or Nuclease-Free Water (NTC) to the appropriate well according to the plate map and gently pipette mix 10 times. The final reaction volume is 10μL. Change tips after each sample addition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":222,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q5in","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"66cf1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eha11","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7boov","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2oqtd","text":"Try to keep wells covered during sample addition to reduce chances of cross contamination. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a03ts","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c764r","text":"If using strip caps, an easy way to reduce chances of cross contamination is to add samples in columns and cap each column as it is completed","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Preparing the RT-qPCR Reaction Mix (10μl Reaction Volume)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8jsa3","text":"Seal the plate with adhesive film or strip caps and centrifuge at approximately 300 × g for 1 minute to ensure all liquid is collected at the bottom of the plate wells. Protect from extended light exposure and keep on cold block/ice before cycling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":86,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ddrv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5kji0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f50i8","text":"Ensure that there are no bubbles in the wells. If there are bubbles, flick the well to disrupt the bubble then centrifuge to collect liquid at the bottom of the well. Repeat until all bubbles are eliminated. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21dfc","text":"Set up a thermal cycler with the following conditions prior to making the reaction mix. This will help reduce the amount of time the plate may be exposed to light or elevated temperatures. A template can be saved for future experiments. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lkf9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dusja","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"l15h","text":"Standard Cycling Conditions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2857","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jned","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9vo0b","text":"Collect data from the following fluorescence channels at the end of each 62°C annealing/extension step. Performing \u003e40 PCR cycles is not recommended as it may generate nonspecific amplification products.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":133,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rs2h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j773","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eo32t","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44c1q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27ee3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"28hmp","text":"The PCR cycling parameters and instrument settings shown here are provided as guidelines and can be modified as necessary for optimal results.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Step","Temperature (ºC)","Time","Number of Cycles"],"colWidths":["135",100,100,100],"data":[["Reverse transcription","45","15 minutes","1"],["RT inactivation/GoTaq® Activation","95","2 minutes","1"],["Denaturation","95","15 seconds","40"],["Annealing/Extension","62","60 secods",""]],"guid":"FEB6BFD0CBC811ECBECCBD70339C4CC1","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6au8a","text":"Table 2. Standard thermal cycling conditions ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reverse transcription","45","15 minutes","1"],["RT inactivation/GoTaq® Activation","95","2 minutes","1"],["Denaturation","95","15 seconds","40"],["Annealing/Extension","62","60 secods",""]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}},"2":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-h-justify"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-h-justify"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-h-justify"},"A_4":{"className":"_dt-h-justify"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-h-justify"},"C_2":{"className":"_dt-h-justify"},"C_3":{"className":"_dt-h-justify"},"C_4":{"className":"_dt-h-justify"}},"colTitles":["Fluorophores","Target"],"colWidths":["175","207"],"data":[["FAM","N1 (SARS-CoV-2)"],["Cal Fluor560/HEX/JOE/VIC","Internal Amplification Control"],["ROX/CXR","Reference Dye"],["Quasar670/Cy5","PMMoV"]],"guid":"EBCCDE20CBD411ECBECCBD70339C4CC1","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c3vtp","text":"Table 3. Fluorophores and targets for components of the reaction mix","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["FAM","N1 (SARS-CoV-2)"],["Cal Fluor560/HEX/JOE/VIC","Internal Amplification Control"],["ROX/CXR","Reference Dye"],["Quasar670/Cy5","PMMoV"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,2]}}}}

steps.section: Preparing the RT-qPCR Reaction Mix (10μl Reaction Volume)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e35ht","text":"Make a plate map of samples, negative controls (NTC), and standards to help keep track of where on the plate each sample should go.    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":132,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a88tn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fa3vl","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aecs0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"1CF623B0CBCD11ECBECCBD70339C4CC1","id":236732,"original_name":"PlateMap.xlsx","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hhf6bccbx.xlsx"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8C43B8C0CBCF11ECBECCBD70339C4CC1","height":414,"id":242624,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a7lbr","text":"Figure 2. Example 96-well plate map with 16 samples (columns 1-4) , 5 standards (A5-E5; A6-E6) and a no template control (NTC) (F5; F6) in duplicate","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-04 at 1.27.50 PM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hn8cbccbx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hn8abccbx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hn8bbccbx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hn79bccbx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eaujo","text":"Common qPCR analysis software packages apply a linear regression to the standard dilution series data and calculate the best fit of the standard curve using y = mx + b, where x = Log10 concentration; y = Cq/Ct; m = slope. r2 measures goodness of fit to the regressed line and m is a measure of efficiency, where m= –3.3 indicates 100% PCR efficiency (i.e., amplification product is doubled at each cycle). The y intercept (b in the equation) is the y value Cq at x = 0. For example, b corresponds to the Cq value for a sample with a concentration of 1 copy/reaction (Log10(1) = 0).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94b4k","text":"In general, the standard curve for each PCR target has an average slope (m) in the range of –3.0 to –3.7 (corresponding to a qPCR efficiency of 86%\u003cE\u003c115%) and an r2 value \u003e0.970. We recommend monitoring y-intercept values for any significant changes from run to run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":180,"length":87}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9mk0c","text":"The IAC can be used to evaluate overall performance of the SARS-CoV-2 RT-qPCR amplification reaction and to detect DNA polymerase and/or reverse transcriptase inhibition. The probe used is a dual-labeled probe (CAL Fluor® 560/ BHQ1). Depending on the qPCR instrument used, HEX, JOE, VIC and CAL Fluor® 560 channels can be used to record the amplification signal. Depending on the qPCR instrument and analysis software used, the IAC Ct should fall in the range of 20–30 for the NTC reactions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":428,"length":63}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing the RT-qPCR Reaction Mix (10μl Reaction Volume)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8av0j","text":"The samples are now ready for thermal cycling using the cycling conditions programmed in Step 4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8f5mc","text":"Wastewater samples typically exhibit PMMoV fluorescence growth curves that cross the threshold at \u003c40 cycles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vr9o","text":"If a sample yields no detectable amplification for SARS-CoV-2 but exhibits IAC amplification (Ct = 20–30), and PMMoV amplification (Ct = 20–40), SARS-CoV-2 is not detectable with this system.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":191}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6kl8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ee1i","text":"Failure to detect PMMoV in wastewater samples may indicate:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3j2jh","text":"improper extraction of nucleic acid from samples resulting in loss of RNA, RNA degradation or both","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"972m5","text":"inhibition of reverse transcriptase, DNA polymerase or both by inhibitors in the sample","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77h32","text":"absence of sufficient nucleic acid due to poor collection or pasteurization of sample","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75aoh","text":"improper assay set up and execution","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afma8","text":"reagent or equipment malfunction","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13m23","text":"\nIf the PMMoV reaction (Cy®5 channel) is negative, IAC is positive and SARS-CoV-2 N1 or N2 or E are positive, the result can be considered valid because PMMoV negativity may reflect a low PMMoV viral load.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hoaa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39msv","text":"If all SARS-CoV-2 markers, PMMoV (process control) and internal amplification control (IAC) are negative for the specimen, the results are invalid. If residual sample is available, repeat the extraction procedure and retest. If all markers remain negative after retesting, report the results as invalid. A new specimen should be collected if possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":148}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bmof","text":"For an NTC, use Nuclease-Free Water in the RT-qPCR instead of a nucleic acid-containing sample or RNA standards. NTC samples should produce amplification curves for the IAC in the HEX™ channel. Sample contamination is indicated if FAM™ or Cy®5 NTC reaction channels exhibit fluorescence curve with Ct value indicating copy number greater than the limit of quantification (LOQ). LOQ for the assay is 20 copies per reaction for SARS-CoV-2 genetic signal (in the FAM channel: N1, N2 and E, respectively).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vk2v","text":"If the IAC Ct in a sample well is shifted significantly (Ct ≥ 2) compared to NTC well, PCR inhibitors are present in the experimental sample, and results should be considered qualitative and not quantitative. Repeat the purification or clean-up of nucleic acid if necessary. If a sample yields no detectable amplification for SARS-CoV-2 but exhibits IAC amplification (Ct = 20–30) and PMMoV amplification (Ct = 20–40), SARS-CoV-2 is not detectable with this system. If the IAC fails to amplify or the IAC Ct is shifted \u003e 3 Ct compared to NTC wells, no conclusions can be made about the absence of SARS-CoV-2 genetic material in a sample. Results can be considered invalid. See Table 4 for examples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abso3","text":"IAC can fail to amplify if assay is setup incorrectly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2unu5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7j61","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"14tu2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2EC4C7A0D55411ECA74461D3F24FC55F","height":348.61818181818165,"id":242628,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ddkjl","text":"Table 5. Interpreting Wastewater Results","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-16 at 4.09.47 PM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hn8gbccbx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hn8ebccbx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hn8fbccbx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hn8dbccbx.webp","width":467.6585365853655}}}}

steps.section: Preparing the RT-qPCR Reaction Mix (10μl Reaction Volume)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"enk1o","text":"After the reaction mix is assembled, mix by flicking or inverting the tube several times then centrifuge to collect contents at bottom of tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"kkj1","text":"The following formula can be applied to quantitate the amount of SARS-CoV-2 nucleic acid in a sample:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt0km","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fa48b","text":"Viral genome (copies/liter) = (Copies in RTqPCR  × 1000 )/ (Volume of nucleic acid extract used in RTqPCR (ml)* ×  Concentration Factor)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mrfc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dq5rf","text":"*If 4µL of nucleic acid is use in RTqPCR, the value in mL is 0.004","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"277bm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6nmb","text":"Concentration Factor = Wastewater sample volume used(mL) / Volume of nucleic acid extracted(mL) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"761vp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d026","text":"Quantitation of PMMoV viral genome copies can be performed using the same approach as for SARS-CoV-2 using the PMMoV RNA Quant Standard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btqi7","text":"Changes in SARS-CoV-2 levels can be analyzed relative to the PMMoV levels by using this formula:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0vqb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9i568","text":"Relative SARS-CoV-2 signal = SARS-CoV-2 signal (copies/liter) / PMMoV signal (copies/liter)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing the RT-qPCR Reaction Mix (10μl Reaction Volume)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7eb4g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1d05f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2p7gv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tn8e","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1n1s8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2hjtv","text":"Do not unseal reaction plates after amplification is complete. Unsealing the plates increases the risk of contaminating subsequent reactions with amplified product. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"876n1","text":"Dispose of PCR plates as biohazardous waste per your institutional guidelines. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
